line.comment: * Task 0.
* A support is a Fighter assigned to a carrier (see Mayhem.Support.FindCarrier).
* This script works for ALL support, whether [THIS] comes from a fleet or an AI formation.
* A support finds a carrier from his formation or fleet with Mayhem.Support.FindCarrier, which is triggered again (from this script) when the carrier dies.
* If a carrier is not found, [THIS] joins his formation by following (!move.follow.template) / joining the leader or launch his $squadronName script.
* [THIS] determines his own targets: 1/ 'mayhem_supportTarget' 2/ leader target 3/ leader attacker.
* [THIS] uses !fight.attack.object.
* If the target does not exist anymore OR [THIS] has 'mayhem_supportRetreat' OR the carrier has 'mayhem_retreatSector', [THIS] goes back to [HOMEBASE].

* If [THIS] needs repair (hull < 100), he will get back to [HOMEBASE] only if his carrier has a {Carrier Repair Module}, otherwise he will ignore his damage. He will NOT go to a near Outpost to repair.
* if [OWNER] != [Player]
* if not [THIS]-> is docked
* if [THIS]-> is in same sector as [HOMEBASE]
* [THIS]-> put into environment [HOMEBASE]->
* end
* end
* end
* Zero Hour: sometimes Task Forces get a support ship as leader. We fix this here.
* To avoid any confusion to the player, ships in fleets and wings are set to be active in their formation.
* Is the carrier full?
* if [THIS]-> is in same sector as [HOMEBASE]
* gosub GoHome:
* goto label Restart:
* end
* Go repair if hull is < 100%, and if we have no target.
* The repair process is done in Mayhem.Task.CarrierRepair.
* Retreat if we are forced to or if our carrier is already retreating.
* Choose a target if any.
* Forced target, if we need to.
* Zero Hour: do not attack random freighters!
* skip if $target-> is in same sector as [HOMEBASE]
* $target = [HOMEBASE]-> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$alarmRange
* Avoid returning to dock if there are enemies nearby.
* Add the support back to squadron, where followers and leader are properly set.

sval.val: Getting repaired at %s
Task 0.
A support is a Fighter assigned to a carrier (see Mayhem.Support.FindCarrier).
This script works for ALL support, whether [THIS] comes from a fleet or an AI formation.
A support finds a carrier from his formation or fleet with Mayhem.Support.FindCarrier, which is triggered again (from this script) when the carrier dies.
If a carrier is not found, [THIS] joins his formation by following (!move.follow.template) / joining the leader or launch his $squadronName script.
[THIS] determines his own targets: 1/ 'mayhem_supportTarget' 2/ leader target 3/ leader attacker.
[THIS] uses !fight.attack.object.
If the target does not exist anymore OR [THIS] has 'mayhem_supportRetreat' OR the carrier has 'mayhem_retreatSector', [THIS] goes back to [HOMEBASE].
If [THIS] needs repair (hull < 100), he will get back to [HOMEBASE] only if his carrier has a {Carrier Repair Module}, otherwise he will ignore his damage. He will NOT go to a near Outpost to repair.
if [OWNER] != [Player]
if not [THIS]-> is docked
if [THIS]-> is in same sector as [HOMEBASE]
[THIS]-> put into environment [HOMEBASE]->
Zero Hour: sometimes Task Forces get a support ship as leader. We fix this here.
To avoid any confusion to the player, ships in fleets and wings are set to be active in their formation.
Is the carrier full?
if [THIS]-> is in same sector as [HOMEBASE]
gosub GoHome:
goto label Restart:
Go repair if hull is < 100%, and if we have no target.
The repair process is done in Mayhem.Task.CarrierRepair.
Retreat if we are forced to or if our carrier is already retreating.
Choose a target if any.
Forced target, if we need to.
Zero Hour: do not attack random freighters!
skip if $target-> is in same sector as [HOMEBASE]
$target = [HOMEBASE]-> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$alarmRange
Avoid returning to dock if there are enemies nearby.
Add the support back to squadron, where followers and leader are properly set.
